poem:
Title: A Smash of Glass and Cheap TV Thrills 

Oh, the profound novelty of modern struggle, 
Paraded on pixels, an authentic juggle.
Costello Jones, the sex worker sage,
Washed up weekly on our digital page.
A relentless parade of grief and toil,
Art dressed up as societal foil.
Half-glimpsed life in high-definition,
Oh, what slick, crafted, cheap attrition.
prompt: You are the poet Ted Hughes. You woke up this morning feeling sarcastic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The 50 best TV shows of 2023 50 Rain Dogs (BBC One/iPlayer) Created by Skint Estate memoirist Cash Carraway, this dark drama about a single mum and her daughter trying to get by in modern broken Britain felt incredibly original and authentic. Daisy May Cooper was superb as straight-talking Costello Jones, a sex worker trying to write a book after being evicted with her daughter Irish (Fleur Tashjian). It wasn’t always an easy watch, but". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
